text:
LOS 11.h
Point estimates are single value estimates of population parameters. An estimator is a
formula used to compute a point estimate.
Confidence intervals are ranges of values, within which the actual value of the parameter
will lie with a given probability.
confidence interval = point estimate + (reliability factor x standard error)
The reliability factor is a number that depends on the sampling distribution of the point
estimate and the probability that the point estimate falls in the confidence interval.
